## Title
 Passenger-Operated Cableway Rebuild at Little Smoky River near Guy

## Tender Summary

The Environment and Climate Change Canada - National Hydrological Service / Water Survey of Canada invites qualified contractors to submit tenders for the Passenger-Operated Cableway Rebuild at Little Smoky River near Guy, Alberta. The project involves the construction of a new passenger-operated cableway to replace the existing one, with the objective of ensuring continuous production of discharge data while minimizing environmental impact.

## Key Project Details

* **Location**: Little Smoky River near Guy, Alberta
* **Project Duration**: Approximately 14 weeks
* **Required Services**: Installation of a new cableway at the existing site, including taller A-Frame steel towers and a 151-meter-span across the river
* **Project Schedule**: Expected contract start date: June 18, 2024; Expected contract end date: March 1, 2025

## Requirements and Specifications

The project requires the contractor to carry out construction services according to applicable guidelines and standards. The cableway design upgrades include taller A-Frame steel towers and a 151-meter-span across the river. The scope of work includes the installation of a new cableway at the existing site, with minimal environmental impact.

## Tendering Procedure

The tendering process is open, and interested suppliers should submit their proposals to Environment and Climate Change Canada - National Hydrological Service / Water Survey of Canada. For additional information, please contact:

* **Helena Lee**: [Helena.Lee@ec.gc.ca](mailto:Helena.Lee@ec.gc.ca)
* Phone: 778-617-2275

## Important Dates

* **Tender Closing Date**: June 11, 2024, at 6:00 PM MDT
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: June 18, 2024

# Notes
Construction services are subject to the provisions of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA). The project is open to all qualified contractors. This project is sponsored by Environment and Climate Change Canada - National Hydrological Service / Water Survey of Canada and partners. The contractor must comply with all applicable regulatory requirements and environmental standards.
